content: This volume on bioeducational research forges a dialogue between education, neuroscience, and biology. It analyses biodynamic perspectives on how learning environments shape brain development, embodied cognition, and perceptual knowledge. This textbook of articles and narratives assists educational professionals and students across diverse disciplines—from education and health to psychology and the humanities. It is an excellent resource for university coursework and a supplemental reading tool. Synthesizing decades of research, this book explores innovations in teaching to enrich the lives of children. It offers practical strategies for educators and parents based on whole child development, creativity, and the power of play. Essential reading. Explore the fragile world of premature babies, their families, and caregivers. Written by an international team of experts, this book blends cutting-edge research with practical strategies, offering an accessible resource for students, educators, and professionals. What can we do about children who withdraw from loving care, or parents lost in the hurts of their own childhood? This book gathers 25 stories from 41 years in infant mental health, revealing how our earliest attachment experiences support or confound our later development. This essential guide to the youth transgender crisis argues social contagion is a key factor in the upsurge. It exposes the perils of medicalization—from puberty blockers to hormones—and offers a vital psychotherapeutic path for families. This book offers a multi-cultural, global perspective on parenting. It combines cultural wisdom with the latest scientific research to guide you in raising a healthy child through every stage, from connecting with an infant to communicating with an adolescent. While smart, many students with learning disabilities don’t know how to learn. This book examines evaluation procedures and intervention programs that recognize student strengths and address their needs, providing guidance for educators and building their capacity to help. This book explores how educators can teach young people to understand the minds of others, helping them navigate identity and relationships. Based on cutting-edge social neuroscience, it translates research into practical, culturally-informed strategies for educational practice. Based on positive psychological research covering the whole lifespan, this volume critically discusses positive education and work and their connection to life-long flourishing. It will appeal to educators, researchers, and anyone interested in the foundations of well-being. Drawing from experiences in Italy and Japan, this book shares successful clinical cases, new diagnostic techniques, and screening tools for early detecting and treating child maltreatment. An essential resource for clinicians, psychotherapists, psychiatrists, and paediatricians. Unlock creative thinking in young children with this guide for educators and parents. It blends theory with practice, offering innovative tools and globally-tested programs. Delve into real-world kindergarten cases to transform how you nurture creativity in education. Using attachment theory, this book explores the faith experiences of Christian women. Based on in-depth interviews, it identifies three patterns of religious attachment—Distance/Avoidance, Anxiety/Ambivalence, and Security—with practical implications for pastoral care. How can teachers bring new ideas into classrooms where students are focused on assessment? This book provides an introduction to the thinking behind these ideas and puts forward a model for classroom activity based on collaboration rather than demonstration. This research explores the relationship between organizational commitment and job satisfaction, showing how it is influenced by the economic sector. Job satisfaction is a key mediator, linking an employee’s commitment to positive organizational citizenship behaviours...
summary: Buku ini menjembatani antara pendidikan, neurosains, dan biologi dalam memahami perkembangan anak dan lingkungan belajar yang memengaruhi perkembangan otak. Buku ini mengusulkan pendekatan berbasis pengalaman tubuh (embodied cognition) dan pengetahuan persepsi, serta menekankan pentingnya lingkungan pendidikan yang mendukung pertumbuhan anak secara holistik. Dengan menggabungkan penelitian terkini dan praktik nyata, buku ini memberikan strategi praktis bagi pendidik dan orang tua dalam membangun kehidupan anak yang sehat, kreatif, dan bermain. Buku ini juga membahas kasus anak yang menarik diri dari perawatan kasih, serta pengaruh pengalaman ikatan awal terhadap perkembangan masa depan. Selain itu, buku ini membahas isu transgen berbasis sosial, menyoroti bahaya dari medisasi seperti blok pembelahan atau hormon, dan menawarkan jalur terapi psikologis bagi keluarga. Dalam perspektif budaya, buku ini mengintegrasikan kebijaksanaan lokal dengan pengetahuan ilmiah untuk membantu orang tua memahami dan membangun hubungan dengan anak dari masa bayi hingga remaja. Buku ini sangat bermanfaat bagi mahasiswa, guru, dan profesional di bidang pendidikan, kesehatan, dan psikologi. Dengan fokus pada kekuatan anak, keberlanjutan perkembangan, dan peran perawatan kasih, buku ini menjadi panduan penting dalam membangun pendidikan yang manusiawi dan berbasis kebutuhan anak.
